Position would be remote - covering the Pacific Northwest and Mountain Regions as they expand their footprint. May work from a home office or shared office space anywhere through the Northwestern region of the US.
Our client is a young and growing firm, so the Sr. Asset Manager will have significant exposure to senior leadership and the opportunity to shape the operations and culture of the company in a significant way as it grows. They currently have 11,000 units and 70+ properties in their portfolio, with another wave on the way as they finish deploying their second fund. They are also raising a third fund.
Responsibilities:● Identify portfolio trends and propose improvements. Utilize data analysis to optimize portfolio performance.● Work closely with 3rd party property managers to create/execute business plans, budgets, and forecasts.● Maximize cash flow and return for portfolio ● Develop and distribute reports conveying financial performance to investors ● Establish strong relationships with key stakeholders, including housing agencies, lenders, and investors. Leverage these relationships to enhance portfolio value, as well as the company value.● Demonstrate a strong monitoring of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Execute underwritten business plans. ● Manage voucher mark-ups, subsidy applications, and relationships to maximize property value. Work with construction/acquisition teams to meet timelines and resolve issues.● Display good judgment in escalating/addressing concerns. Proactively communicate with colleagues to find solutions.● Contribute to a strong team culture within Asset Management and the broader organization. Share ideas for process improvement, actively participate in collaborative processes with internal teams, and maintain a solutions-oriented approach in all interactions.● Determine capex needs of the portfolio, funding sources and savings opportunities● Reduce utility expenses where possible● Ensure each asset is in compliance 
Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree preferably with a concentration in Real Estate, Finance, or Business. Advanced degree a plus.7+ years of relevant experience in asset management.Self-motivated and hard-working.Strong analytical skills and quantitative skills with advanced skills in financial analysis.Knowledge of corporate finance, accounting, and valuation methodologies.Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, with mastery in Excel.Highly organized, detail-oriented, motivated, and able to multi-task effectively in a deadline-driven environment.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Ability to occasionally travel to portfolio

title: Correctional Food Service Officer I NC Dept. of Adult Correction-Davidson
description:
Description Of Work

 NOW ELIGIBLE FOR A $7,000 SIGN ON BONUS! 

 To be eligible for a sign-on bonus, the candidate must not have worked as a probationary, permanent, or time-limited employee in the last 12 months as an employee subject to the State Human Resources Act.” 

This Position is Eligible for the Applicant Referral Bonus

This position is located at Davidson Correctional Center.

The position provides supervision and custody of inmates in their assigned food preparation & food service work areas. Oversees inmate workers engaged in a varieyy of activites in food production including cooking, baking, and serving. Work includes but is not limited to: communicating verbally and in writing; comprehend computer data; secure and maintain equipment; read, comprehend and calculate menus; Observe sanitary food handling practices; understand food nutritional values; inventory and rotate stock; complete CPR, firearms, unarmed self defense (CRDT); and work a varied schedule.

 This is a full-time position (40 hours per week) with State Benefits .

Note To Current State Employees

The salary grade for this position is NC05. State employees are encouraged to apply for positions of interest even if the salary grade is the same as, or lower than, their current position. If selected for this position, a new salary will be recalculated taking into consideration the quantity of relevant education and experience, funding availability, and internal equity. Based upon these factors, a pay increase MAY result.

Salary Grade:NC05 Salary Range: $31,688.00 - $55,453.00

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities / Competencies

The Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities listed below, along with the Minimum Education and Experience requirements, are REQUIRED to qualify for this position. We will not review resumes in lieu of the Experience and Education listed on the application. Click these links for additional information: Introduction to the Job Application and Addressing Knowledge, Skills and Abilities . (Note: These links were created for applicants of Dept. of Adult Correction jobs and may not reflect the policies or procedures of other State agencies.)

To qualify for this position, applicants must document on the application that they possess ALL of the following:

Documented knowledge of large-scale food production and food service activities

Documented knowledge of cooking equipment used in commercial and/or institutional kitchens

Minimum Education And Experience Requirements

 Some state job postings say you can qualify by an “equivalent combination of education and experience”. If that language appears below, then you may qualify through EITHER years of education OR years of directly related experience OR a combination of both. See 

oshr.nc.gov/experience-guide for details.

High school or General Educational Development (GED) diploma and one year of experience in institutional food preparation and food services, in management of a commercial food service operations, as a Correctional Officer; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Necessary Special Qualifications Must be eligible for certification by the North Carolina Criminal Justice Education & Training Standards Commission.

Supplemental and Contact Information

About The NC Dept. Of Adult Correction (DAC)

The North Carolina Department of Adult Correction is responsible for the care, custody, and supervision of all adults sentenced after conviction for violation North Carolina laws. This department includes State Prisons, Correction Enterprises, the Division of Community Supervision, and the Division of Rehabilitation & Reentry.

The North Carolina Department of Adult Correction (DAC) is an Equal Opportunity Employer who embraces an Employment First philosophy which consists of complying with all federal laws, state laws and Executive Orders. We are committed to reviewing requests for reasonable accommodation at any time during the hiring process or while on the job.

DAC uses the Merit-Based Recruitment and Selection Plan to fill positions subject to the State Human Resources Act with the most qualified individuals. Hiring salary will be based on relevant qualifications, internal equity, and budgetary considerations pertinent to the advertised position.

It is critical to our screening and salary determination process that applications contain comprehensive information. Information should be provided in the appropriate areas to include the beginning and ending dates of jobs worked, education with the date graduated, all work experience, and certificates / licenses. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of completing this application. Answers to Supplemental Questions must refer to education or work experience listed on this application to receive credit. Degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.

Applicants seeking Veteran's Preference must attach a DD-214 Member-4 Form (Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty) to their applications.Applicants seeking National Guard Preference must attach a NGB 23A (RPAS) if they are a current member of the NC National Guard in good standing. If a former member of the NC National Guard who served for at least 6 years and was discharged under honorable conditions, they must attach either a DD256 or NGB 22.If applicants earned college credit hours but did not complete a degree program, they must attach an unofficial transcript to each application to receive credit for this education.If applying for a position certified through the NC Dept. of Justice - Criminal Justice Standards Division, click this link for specific certification requirements: Correctional & Probation/Parole Officer Certification .The NC Dept. of Adult Correction must adhere to the US Dept. of Justice Final Rule on the "National Standards to Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Prison Rape." Click this link for information on hiring and promotion prohibition requirements for all positions in the NC Dept. of Adult Correction: PREA Hiring and Promotion Prohibitions .Per NC General Statute 143B-972.1 , applicants hired into a position certified as a criminal justice officer or justice officer are required to electronically submit fingerprints to the NC State Bureau of Investigation for a state and national criminal history record check and enrollment in the FBI’s Next Generation Identification System: Criminal Justice Record of Arrest and Prosecution Background Service (“RAP Back”) . This is in addition to submitting fingerprints during the application process.

Due to the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information regarding the status of your application over the phone. To check the status of your application, please log in to your account and click "Application Status." If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by management. If you are no longer under consideration, you will receive an email notification.

For technical issues with your application, please call the GovernmentJobs.com Applicant Support Help Line at 855-524-5627. If there are any questions about this posting other than your application status, please contact Kathy Fox at 828-757-5738.

title: Program Supervisor - Foster Care Program
description:
Position: Program Supervisor for Nobody Ages Out Program (with Foster Care experience)Location: New York City, Hybrid (1-2x a week)Salary Budget: $45,000 - 50,000 annually
The Nobody Ages Out (NAO) program works with NYC foster care agencies to find parents for older youth in their foster boarding and residential care programs who are at risk of aging out of care and are in need of a permanent family.
Reporting to the Director of Youth Services, the NAO supervisor assists with clarifying and executing best practices for the organization. The supervisor is responsible for NAO functions and shares accountability for the overall achievement of NAO objectives.
The NAO supervisor represents our client's with enthusiasm, honesty, and deep appreciation for its values, mission and potential. The NAO supervisor represents the NAO program and serves as an effective cultivator of agencies to engage in our client's mission, and contributes facilitative leadership, organization and task execution to support the Director of Youth Services, while supervising the youth advocate team, conducting their training, development, and coordinated actions.
RESPONSIBILITIESSupervision of Youth Advocates. Provides close supervision and supports achievement of self-defined learning goals, professional growth opportunities, educational goals, mental health needs and daily organizational priorities; cultivates individual and shared leadership; supports effective coordinated action and timely delivery on commitments; seeks to expand the team of youth leaders who effectively represent and spread the organization's mission.Program Administration. Provides administrative support; creates and tracks assessments and feedback forms; approves bi-weekly time sheets; schedules opportunities for reporting and communications across staff. Drafts reports and correspondence, conducts faxing, filing, photocopying, travel arrangements, and maintains tracking information. Offers weekly assistance in creating NAO schedules, determining priority goals and tasks. Assign advocates to Game Nights, Quarantine and chill, empowerment groups, MAPP classes, all Workshop, and conferences.Staff Collaboration. Maintains daily contact with the Director of Youth Services and other Senior Staff. Maintains written records and drafts communications and materials to support collaboration and accountability across staff and board.Partner Agency - Client Communications and Service. Supports communications, scheduling, and assessment of agency services. Coordinates logistics and preparations for NAO’s workshops, meetings and special events. Assures that Advocates are effectively engaged in leadership roles.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCEBachelor’s degree preferredMust have at least 2-4 years demonstrated experience as a supervisorMust have at least four years of related work experience working with older youth in child welfareFacilitation skills and comfortable presenting to internal and external stakeholdersExperience and expertise with Excel, PowerPoint and desktop publishing software, designing flyers, brochures, and using visuals and graphic artExtensive experience providing administrative and office management supports for a collaborative team; manage scheduling, clerical duties and providing diverse assistanceExperience cultivating shared leadership, and providing direction and support to foster effective teams
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Strong commitment to the mission and values of the organizationHighly organized, self-starterMeticulous attention to detail and resultsSolid problem-solving skillsGood technical aptitudeComfortable with organizing and coordinating a wide range of diverse activitiesWorks well alone and also enjoys relating with a diverse group of people in a team-oriented approachHumor and creative initiative combined with ability to be firmWelcomes input and direction from supervisorsExcellent interpersonal, writing and communications skillsTrauma-informed
ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS. All employees must consistently demonstrate an intention to contribute effectively to the cultivation and ongoing stewardship of organizational relationships.PHYSICAL DEMANDS. Position is located in New York City and will require inner city travel; standing for two hours or more to conduct workshops, and sitting for long periods of computer work.WORK ENVIRONMENT. Our client offers a creative, relatively quiet community space. There is flexibility in scheduling both work hours and location, as the project needs demand. Work space differs from day-to-day, requiring flexibility and adaptability.
Note: Applicants and employees shall not be discriminated against because of race, religion, sex, national origin, ethnicity, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender (including pregnancy and gender expression) identity, color, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law or ordinance. Reasonable accommodation will be made so that qualified disabled applicants may participate in the application process. Please advise in writing of special needs at the time of application.

title: Incentive Compensation Accounting, AVP
description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

Who we are looking for

State Street's Corporate Controllership organization is seeking an Assistant Vice President to join the Compensation & Benefits Accounting Team. The Compensation & Benefits Accounting team is an exciting, challenging and highly visible group supporting the Controllers Organization, Business and Finance Leaders, Global Human Resources, and Financial Planning & Analysis teams.

Why this role is important to us

The team you will be joining plays an important role in the overall success of the organization. Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. To make that happen we need teams like yours to help navigate employees and the organization as a whole. In your role you will strive for cutting-edge solutions, that are straightforward and scalable. You will help us build resilience and execute day to day deliverables at our best. Join us if making your mark in the financial services industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.

What you will be responsible for

Incentive Compensation

The specific responsibilities for this role:

Lead the incentive compensation accounting, reporting and analysis function for all of State Street including international locationsWork with other Compensation & Benefits Accounting team members where incentive compensation tasks overlap such as expatriate accounting, retirement plans and reduction-in-force programsManipulate and analyze large amounts of data to provide insights to internal stakeholders (other areas of Controllership, Finance, and Global Human Resources) on expenses and potential savingsComplete monthly, quarterly and annual reporting including 10Q/K submissions and Regulatory ReportingPartner with Financial Planning & Analysis and Global Human Resources on incentive compensation annual budget and mid-year forecastWork with external vendor on approving new awards, updating pricing and running reports

Benefits

Lead US benefit accounting for medical/dental benefits, payroll taxes, and other benefits as assignedWork with Global Human Resources and Finance on analyzing spend, budgeting and variance analysis

What we value

These Skills Will Help You Succeed In This Role

High level of integrity and trustworthiness handling sensitive informationAbility to work in a fasted paced environment and managing multiple deliverables and projectsAttention to detail and strong risk and control-oriented mindsetExcellent written and verbal communication skills

Education & Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related disciplinePrevious work experience in Finance or Accounting incentive compensation role preferredStrong Excel skills and comfort with large amounts of data

Are you the right candidate? Yes!

We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don't necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we're making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we've been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Salary Range

$80,000 - $132,500 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

title: Integration Service operations, Vice President
description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

State Street Integration Services (iSVCS) is a strategic shared services integration platform developed in-house that provides integration solutions and services across State Street Alpha, Global Services, Global Markets (SSgM), Global Advisors (SSgA), and Global Exchange (SSgX); integrating our various business areas with our systems and our clients. The solutions architected/ developed today provide extreme scale for high volume messaging and high availability at an enterprise level. Good to have - Experience with UNIX and shell scripting. Good to have - Experience in or knowledge of Agile or Industrialized Agile.

Our technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We're driving the company's digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence, and robotics process automation.

We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We're looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.

Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems, and make your mark on our industry.

About State Street

From technology to product innovation, we're making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we've been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. title: Material Handler II
description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

Job Description

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you'll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world's toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

How will you make an impact?

We want enthusiastic, dependable, hard-working, standout colleagues that will make a difference for our customers and fellow colleagues every day. The impact you will have could be anything from delivering products that help a scientist discover a cure for cancer to helping a nurse care for a patient effectively because they have the right equipment.

A Day In The Life

Process customer orders daily to meet their expectations.Work in one or more process paths; receiving, picking, packing, or shipping.Package and label shipments according to standard operating procedures and complete documentation requirements for hazardous materials.Help ensure inventory is stored accurately.Work with your team to make sure everyone has a magical experience working at Thermo Fisher Scientific.

Keys To Success

Education

High school diploma or equivalent required.

Experience

1+ years of general warehouse experience (Forklift/Picker)Experience with powered industrial trucks (order pickers).Experience handling hazardous materials (chemicals) is a plus.Experience with computers and scanning equipment preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

Ability to stand and move about the warehouse for significant periods of time (involving walking, stooping, bending, and reaching) required.Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.Desire to work as part of a team, but also able to work independently and solve problems quickly.Ability to read and write in English.Ability to lift, carry, and push up to 70 lbs frequently and 100 lbs occasionally.

Shift

1st Shift (Monday-Friday), 8:30am-5pm, Possible OTCompensation: $20.75/hr. 

We offer competitive salary, an annual incentive bonus plan, and a range of other employee benefits!

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility/Disability Access

Job Seekers with a Disability: Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations in the job application process. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker with a disability, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.

This telephone line is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes, such as not being able to get into the career website, following up on an application, or other non-disability related technical issues will not receive a response.

Compensation And Benefits

The hourly pay range estimated for this position based in Washington is $17.00-$18.00.

This Position May Also Be Eligible To Receive a Variable Annual Bonus Based On Company, Team, And/or Individual Performance Results In Accordance With Company Policy. We Offer a Comprehensive Total Rewards Package That Our U.S. Colleagues And Their Families Can Count On, Which Includes

A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan, including health incentive programsEmployee assistance and family support programs, including commuter benefits and tuition reimbursementAt least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, and short- and long-term disability in accordance with company policyRetirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings planEmployees' Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount

For more information on our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards

title: Project Manager
description:
Job Opportunity: Project Manager with ElitAire - Indianapolis, Indiana 
Do you pride yourself on your ability to manage and inspire people? Do you thrive on continuous improvement and optimizing efficiency? Are you seeking a highly collaborative environment? If so, we want you to join our team!
As a Project Manager at ElitAire, you will provide application support for internal and external customers using equipment selection and application knowledge.
Other responsibilities include:
Provide day to day project management for orders which have been executed.Responsible for coordinating with service organizations and their technicians on start-up, warranty, and troubleshooting related items.Provide technical assistance and develop proposal and pricing estimates.Understand HVAC airside and waterside systems to assist customers with equipment selection and application.Understand multiple technologies associated with equipment from various manufacturing partners.Provide equipment selections using manufacturer specific software or working with key individuals within manufacturer’s organization.Provide technical assistance to Account Managers and External Customers to ensure proper equipment selection and appropriate application to achieve the desired objective.Develop scope and/or proposal for equipment selected including any required costs such as options, accessories, delivery, and other costs that may be associated with the project.Document criteria used to select equipment and maintain information in project file.Assist Account Managers with customer specific marketing strategies.Communicate with new and existing customers to develop or maintain relationship.Site visits will be required (travel is estimated to be between 10%-25%).
The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to problem solve and make decisions without close supervision. They must be self-motivated, accurate, efficient, and capable of responding to customer needs. Additionally, this candidate will have:
Bachelor of Engineering or Construction Management, preferred. (Equivalent experience or Associate Degree will also be considered)Great written and oral communication skills.Fluent with computer applications and operating systems including Windows, Word, and Excel.Knowledge of Computer Aided Drafting software, such as AutoCAD, Revit or SolidWorks is a plus.
Join ElitAire, where our commitment to both customers and our team defines our success. We prioritize people and deliver top-notch sales, service, and controls to the commercial and industrial HVAC market across Ohio, Kentucky, and Indiana. Since 2008, we've grown from 7 employees to a thriving team of approximately 95, and we're on a robust trajectory of expansion. 
To learn more about ElitAire, visit our website and our LinkedIn page:
https://elitaire.com/https://www.linkedin.com/company/elitaire/
This is an exciting opportunity to do something extraordinary: Join a growing team that delivers engineered solutions for sustainable design and energy efficient HVAC systems. Come join us by applying online at https://grnh.se/768d5a7b3us or email job@strategichrinc.com!
Employer is EEO/M/F/D/V. Please no third-party candidates or phone calls.

title: Tax Analyst - US Operations Analyst (Remote)
description:
Job Description

Corporate Tax department of a large multi-national service corporation. The department is responsible for filing a consolidated federal income tax return, with approximately 85 subsidiaries. Also, the department files 27 combined state income tax returns and approximately 900 separate company state and local income and franchise tax returns. In addition, the tax department is heavily involved with the company’s compliance with ASC 740.

This is a is a hybrid/remote role preferably located in Eastern Standard Time zone states.

Note: Employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.

The Role

Support the U.S. federal income tax compliance process in order to meet external filing requirementsPrepare US federal proforma and consolidated return items, including any book-tax adjustmentsPrepare US state income and franchise tax returns Prepare calculations for estimated payments and extensionsPreparation of Forms 5471 and Form 8858 for international entitiesProvide support on annual and quarterly tax provision calculations, including any book-tax adjustments, tax account reconciliations and return to provision calculations

Qualifications

The Requirements:

Undergraduate degree in Accounting required, Masters in Tax preferred Prior internship/tax experience preferred (0-4 years), with US outbound experience a plusAbility to comprehend income tax accounting theory and tax compliance lawsHighly proficient in Microsoft OfficeExperience with ONESOURCE Income Tax (OIT) and/or Corp Tax; ONESOURCE Tax Provision (OTP); Alteryx; Oracle/SAP a plus Strong analytical and communication skillsBasic understanding of US Internal Revenue Code and ASC 740; Pillar II experience a plusAbility to work independently and with others as a team

Compensation And Benefits

Base salary range and benefits information for this position are being included in accordance with requirements of various state/local pay transparency legislation. Please note that base salaries may vary for different individuals in the same role based on several factors, including but not limited to location of the role, individual competencies, education/professional certifications, qualifications/experience, performance in the role and potential for revenue generation (Producer roles only).

Compensation

The base salary compensation range being offered for this role is $60,000-$100,000 USD per year.

This role is also eligible for an annual short-term incentive bonus.

Company Benefits

WTW provides a competitive benefit package which includes the following (eligibility requirements apply):

Health and Welfare Benefits: Medical (including prescription coverage), Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Commuter Account, Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Group Accident, Group Critical Illness, Life Insurance, AD&D, Group Legal, Identify Theft Protection, Wellbeing Program and Work/Life Resources (including Employee Assistance Program)Leave Benefits: Paid Holidays, Annual Paid Time Off (includes paid state/local paid leave where required), Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Other Leaves (e.g., Bereavement, FMLA, ADA, Jury Duty, Military Leave, and Parental and Adoption Leave) Paid Time Off Retirement Benefits: Contributory Pension Plan and Savings Plan (401k). All Level 38 and more senior roles may also be eligible for non-qualified Deferred Compensation and Deferred Savings Plans.

EOE, including disability/vets

This position will remain posted for a minimum of three business days from the date posted or until a sufficient/appropriate candidate slate has been identified.

title: DIRTT New Business Development and Sales Champion
description:
If crafting a strategic roadmap for new business initiatives, sales and growth is your passion, we've got the career for you! title: Epidemiology Data Developer IV - Remote
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together. 
The Epidemiology Data Developer IV develops and manages data assets and infrastructure in support of Epidemiology’s government related public health surveillance and research activities. Additionally, may support the Epidemiology group with ad-hoc data exploration and innovation. Supports Epidemiology analyst group by serving as Subject Matter Expert in a particular data type or analytic process.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities: Project-specific ResponsibilitiesExtracting and linking data from multiple DBMS sources and creating analytic limited datasets for use by analysts.Scheduled data refreshes, quality control, and infrastructure ETL management including addressing data follow-up questions, issues, enhancements, etc.Managing data processing environment – e.g., folder design, disk space, backups, archivingMaintaining secure data environment that utilizes PII/encryption in infrastructure processesProactively assesses opportunities to provide quality improvement and efficiency in processesCreate/modify/execute/programs/files (typically SAS/SQL, scripting, Unix/Linux)Validate programs/processes (typically SAS/SQL) to ensure accuracy and consistencySupport linkage to PHI as needed (e.g., support for medical record retrieval, National Death Index search, linking of moms to babies for pregnancy related work)Collaborate, support, and share data infrastructure responsibilities/tasks with other data developer colleague(s)Provide analytic advice to research team members; investigate issues with the data and reports findingsWork with researchers and analysts to develop technical specifications documents to investigate data or implement ETL updatesCreate and maintain technical documentation, including data access requirements, infrastructure design, and ETL process steps and supporting quality controlAssess time needed to accomplish tasks; shifts priorities/projects as neededOther ResponsibilitiesMay assist in the preparation of bids for new work, including completing (or overseeing the completion of) feasibility requestsServe as technical resource to other analysts. Present new programs/techniquesMay assist with interviewing, onboarding, training, or other activities that support the analyst team
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications: MS in a scientific or technical field, or similar/related field, with 7+ years of professional experience in pharmaceutical/biotech, healthcare, or research setting - OR BS in a scientific or technical field, or similar/related field, with 12+ years of professional experience in pharmaceutical biotech, healthcare, or research setting7+ years of advanced programming experience with SAS and SQLExperience working with medical and pharmacy claims and/or clinical dataExperience working with large Database Management Systems (DBMS)Proven good Unix/Linux skills, including Korn Shell (KSH) scriptingProven comfortable collaborating, supporting, and sharing data infrastructure responsibilities/tasks/ideas with data developer colleague(s)
Preferred Qualifications: Experience managing large data (e.g., appends/refreshes, chunking, HASH tables)Experience implementing quality control measures and validating programs and processes in SAS and SQLExperience with UHG/Optum DBMS (e.g., Galaxy, ORD)Experience developing data assets in support of government related public health surveillance and research activities
*All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington residents is $88,000 to $173,200 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission. 

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. 
UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Digital Experience Consultant II (UI/UX Product Designer)
description:
We’ve Got You Under Our WingWe are the duck. We develop and empower our people, cultivate relationships, give back to our community, and celebrate every success along the way. We do it all…The Aflac Way.
Aflac, a Fortune 500 company, is an industry leader in voluntary insurance products that pay cash directly to policyholders and one of America's best-known brands. Aflac has been recognized as Fortune’s 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity and as one of World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere.com.
Our business is about being there for people in need. So, ask yourself, are you the duck? If so, there’s a home, and a flourishing career for you at Aflac.
Work Designation. Depending on your location within the continental US, this role may be hybrid or remote.If you live within 50 miles of the Aflac offices located in Columbus, GA this role will be hybrid. This means you will be expected to work in the office for at least 60% of the work week. You will work from your home (within the continental US) for the remaining portion of the work week. Details of this schedule will be discussed with your leadership.If you live more than 50 miles from the Aflac offices located in Columbus, GA, this role will be remote. This means you will be expected to work from your home, within the continental US. If the role is remote, there may be occasions that you are requested to come to the office based on business need. Any requests to come to the office would be communicated with you in advance.
What does it take to be successful at Aflac?Acting with IntegrityCommunicating EffectivelyPursuing Self-DevelopmentServing CustomersSupporting ChangeSupporting Organizational GoalsWorking with Diverse Populations
What does it take to be successful in this role?Self-starter who is able to work and thrive autonomouslyProven ability to manage and lead in an ambiguous environmentAn eye for detail, highly skilled in problem solving, and an ability to create engaging user experiencesStrong communication and organizational skills, with experience collaborating with product managers and developers to deliver solutions that influence user behaviorsAdvanced proficiency in user experience, interaction, and user interface design for digital tools applicationsAn understanding of the principles of product design, and experience conducting design sprints and/or delivery within an Agile modelExperience within uncovering user pain points and opportunities; and prioritizing insights through user experience research discovery and testingProven ability to work cross functionally across multiple business units, including influencing others without a direct line of reportingAdvanced level skills and experience with common user experience design/development/research tools and methodologies (eg Figma, Atlassian, Dovetail, design systems)Advanced level skills and experience with Design Thinking or other User and Human-Centered Design techniquesAbility to move between high level conceptual design/vision and the tactical workBuild and cultivate strong relationships via teamwork and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization and the ability to collaborate to reach a common agreementInnovative thinker with the ability to ask powerful questions that open up dialog like "what if”; willingness to try new ideasEngaging and impactful communicator; ability to address a variety of audiences with data-driven messaging that resonates; demonstrated experience influencing senior leadershipExperience and knowledge in agency/resource managementFamiliarity with the insurance industry/benefits administration a plusWilling to travel as needed
Education & Experience RequiredBachelor’s Degree in Marketing, business administration, computer science or related fieldSix or more years of professional job related experience in digital product design/development or related experienceExperience with technology or digital deliveryOr an equivalent combination of education and experience
Education & Experience PreferredCertification in Design Thinking or other human centered design approaches
TravelLess than or equal to 10%
Job SummaryResponsible for designing and delivering on Aflac’s vision of creating a unified, seamless digital experience across channels that enables customers to engage with us whenever, wherever, and however they prefer. Understand and advocate for customer needs, working with key business partners, digital execution, and brand marketing teams to ensure strategic alignment, guide prioritization, and ultimately improve the value derived from digital investments.
Principal Duties & ResponsibilitiesStrategically influences the design of digital solutions by collaborating closely with product managers and owners during agile ceremonies; designs digital engagements that deliver the optimal customer experience and improve operational efficiency, focusing on opportunities identified through service design.Helps translate user needs and business priorities into compelling digital solutions that are intuitive and drive higher adoption and customer satisfaction.Leads the creation and implementation of digital strategy and standards, partnering with crossfunctional stakeholders in business and digital services to gain alignment and ensure delivery of a seamless end-to-end experiences that improves ease.Works horizontally to define and influence customer roadmaps; connecting the dots among products and services in the customer journey and guides prioritization across the enterprise for customer groups; understanding their current state experience and the pain points they face, as well as the ideal experience that we are striving to achieve.Proactively identifies and directs improvements to optimize digital solutions; ensures we are delivering upon our customer experience commitment of providing Assurance, Convenience, and Value by employing user-centered design approaches.Delivers common user research and experience methods such as usability testing, heuristic reviews, wireframes, prototypes and screen mockups to help communicate to various audiences when needed.Helps to evolve the current set of design tools and standards, advocating for applying humancentered design to digital product development; increases understanding and advocates for design thinking.Builds and cultivates strong relationships across the organization and partners with those responsible for delivering digital solutions for assigned customer segmentLeads and manages medium to large-scale initiatives as assigned; manages two or more projects simultaneously; ensures the projects drive value and meet agreed upon success criteria.Performs other duties as required.
Total RewardsThis compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. The range has been created in good faith based on information known to Aflac at the time of the posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. This salary range does not include any potential incentive pay or benefits, however, such information will be provided separately when appropriate. The salary range for this position is $70,000 - $160,000.
In addition to the base salary, we offer an array of benefits to meet your needs including medical, dental, and vision coverage, prescription drug coverage, health care flexible spending, dependent care flexible spending, Aflac supplemental policies (Accident, Cancer, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity offered at no costs to employee), 401(k) plans, annual bonuses, and an opportunity to purchase company stock. On an annual basis, you’ll also be offered 11 paid holidays, up to 20 days PTO to be used for any reason, and, if eligible, state mandated sick leave (Washington employees accrue 1 hour sick leave for every 40 hours worked) and other leaves of absence, if eligible, when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Aflac complies with all applicable leave laws, including, but not limited to sick and safe leave, and adoption and parental leave, in all states and localities.

title: Accounting Clerk I NC Dept. of Adult Correction-Avery
description:
Description Of Work

This position is located at Mountain View Correctional Institution in Spruce Pine, NC.

This position is responsible for the maintenance, oversight, and reporting of financial accounting data. Is also required to perform other accounting duties, including, but not limited to: trust fund accounting and canteen reporting. Must be able to analyze data for accuracy, to problem-solve, and to interpret policies and procedures. This employee should be able to plan, organize, read and analyze Departmental policies and unit Standard Operating Procedure. Is responsible to ensure uniform accounting procedures are followed in processing requests, warehouse and contact vendor purchases, and payables. Duties are to be discharged in accurately, complete, and in accordance with Department of Corrections Fiscal Policy and Procedure. This position is responsible for maintaining all related procurement and payables files and logs as well as Trust Fund files.

This is a full-time position (40 hours per week) with State Benefits . 

Note To Current State Employees

The salary grade for this position is NC02. State employees are encouraged to apply for positions of interest even if the salary grade is the same as, or lower than, their current position. If selected for this position, a new salary will be recalculated taking into consideration the quantity of relevant education and experience, funding availability, and internal equity. Based upon these factors, a pay increase MAYresult.

 Salary Grade: NC02 Salary Range: $31,200 - $47,903

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities / Competencies

The Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities listed below, along with the Minimum Education and Experience requirements, are REQUIRED to qualify for this position. We will not review resumes in lieu of the Experience and Education listed on the application. Click these links for additional information: Introduction to the Job Application and Addressing Knowledge, Skills and Abilities . (Note: These links were created for applicants of Dept. of Adult Correction jobs and may not reflect the policies or procedures of other State agencies.)

To qualify for this position, applicants must document on the application that they possess ALL of the following:

Documented knowledge of accounting methods, procedures, and accounting practices needed to perform the work.

Minimum Education And Experience Requirements

 Some state job postings say you can qualify by an “equivalent combination of education and experience”. If that language appears below, then you may qualify through EITHER years of education OR years of directly related experience OR a combination of both. See  oshr.nc.gov/experience-guide 

High school or General Educational Development (GED) diploma; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Supplemental and Contact Information

About The NC Dept. Of Adult Correction (DAC)

The North Carolina Department of Adult Correction is responsible for the care, custody, and supervision of all adults sentenced after conviction for violation North Carolina laws. This department includes State Prisons, Correction Enterprises, the Division of Community Supervision, and the Division of Rehabilitation & Reentry.

The North Carolina Department of Adult Correction (DAC) is an Equal Opportunity Employer who embraces an Employment First philosophy which consists of complying with all federal laws, state laws and Executive Orders. We are committed to reviewing requests for reasonable accommodation at any time during the hiring process or while on the job.

DAC uses the Merit-Based Recruitment and Selection Plan to fill positions subject to the State Human Resources Act with the most qualified individuals. Hiring salary will be based on relevant qualifications, internal equity, and budgetary considerations pertinent to the advertised position.

It is critical to our screening and salary determination process that applications contain comprehensive information. Information should be provided in the appropriate areas to include the beginning and ending dates of jobs worked, education with the date graduated, all work experience, and certificates / licenses. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of completing this application. Answers to Supplemental Questions must refer to education or work experience listed on this application to receive credit. Degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.

Applicants seeking Veteran's Preference must attach a DD-214 Member-4 Form (Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty) to their applications.Applicants seeking National Guard Preference must attach a NGB 23A (RPAS) if they are a current member of the NC National Guard in good standing. If a former member of the NC National Guard who served for at least 6 years and was discharged under honorable conditions, they must attach either a DD256 or NGB 22.If applicants earned college credit hours but did not complete a degree program, they must attach an unofficial transcript to each application to receive credit for this education.If applying for a position certified through the NC Dept. of Justice - Criminal Justice Standards Division, click this link for specific certification requirements: Correctional & Probation/Parole Officer Certification .The NC Dept. of Adult Correction must adhere to the US Dept. of Justice Final Rule on the "National Standards to Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Prison Rape." Click this link for information on hiring and promotion prohibition requirements for all positions in the NC Dept. of Adult Correction: PREA Hiring and Promotion Prohibitions .Per NC General Statute 143B-972.1 , applicants hired into a position certified as a criminal justice officer or justice officer are required to electronically submit fingerprints to the NC State Bureau of Investigation for a state and national criminal history record check and enrollment in the FBI’s Next Generation Identification System: Criminal Justice Record of Arrest and Prosecution Background Service (“RAP Back”) . This is in addition to submitting fingerprints during the application process.

Due to the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information regarding the status of your application over the phone. To check the status of your application, please log in to your account and click "Application Status." If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by management. If you are no longer under consideration, you will receive an email notification.

For technical issues with your application, please call the GovernmentJobs.com Applicant Support Help Line at 855-524-5627. If there are any questions about this posting other than your application status, please contact Kathy Fox at 828-757-5738.

title: Engineering Customer Support
description:
Who are we?Phase IV is a wholly owned subsidiary of Wika Instrument LP. From our beginning in 1992, in Boulder, CO, Phase IV Engineering has been an innovator in wireless sensing. Our founder Rich Pollack started Phase IV as a “Skunk Works”, designing highly advanced and technically challenging sensors for Fortune 500 companies, NASA, the US military, and scientific research. We invented the world’s first battery-free RFID wireless temperature and pressure sensor. (Among many other applications, this sensor currently flies inside the wheel valve stem of every Boeing 777 and 787 aircraft.) Phase IV has expertise in energy harvesting, RF design, low-power circuit design, and designing for very harsh environments. This over 100 years combined experience was a key reason our Phase IV Engineering team was recognized as the “Sensor Engineering Team of the Year” in 2015 by Sensors Magazine and won “Product of the Year” in 2017 from RFID Journal.
BASIC PURPOSE:This position uses knowledge of product portfolio and engineering principles as well as sales data to resolve challenging technical problems. This individual helps customers troubleshoot various problems, analyzes root cause of failures and works closely with engineering to provide support for testing and R&D.
MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES/RESPONSIBILITIES OF JOB:Assists engineering in product testing and troubleshootingPerforms customer technical support (phone and email) to quickly resolve technical problems, questions and installation issues without the need to return the productResearches, diagnoses, troubleshoots, and resolves customer issuesAssists manufacturing in mechanical and/or electrical assembliesSupports custom assemblies and proto-typingWorks with different systems, software, and hardware and follow standard procedures to escalate unresolved issues to engineeringUtilizes the RMA process to bring failed product in from the field and perform root cause failure analysis upon requestProvides feedback on failures to engineering to support product improvements and new developmentsFollows up with new customers to assist and ensures installation of product has been completedProvides feedback to help improve manuals and other documentationStrives for continuous personal development of product & application knowledge, business operations, and industry standardsPerforms ancillary duties as needed
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:College Degree in Electronics or equivalent work experience required5+ years’ experience in a technical product support role preferredKnowledge of industrial instrumentation an assetExcellent Communication Skills, verbal and writtenExcellent Client Facing SkillsStrong problem solving skillsExtensive knowledge of Microsoft OfficePossess strong organizational skillsSelf-motivated and able to investigate, listen and make decisions based on data presented on new topics not previously known

title: Peer Navigator, Street Medicine (San Bernardino)
description:
At Healthcare in Action, we serve patients experiencing homelessness through an innovative “street medicine” approach by contracting with Medicare and Medicaid health plans as well as hospitals and health systems.

Street medicine entails using a medically equipped van to deliver medical care directly to people experiencing homelessness in locations such as parking lots, encampments, and parks.

The Peer Navigator supports members who are experiencing/ are at risk of experiencing homeless with managing their own health in the San Bernadino area. Assist in motivating behavioral changes in patients to improve health outcomes through education, peer support, housing & resource navigation, and the relaying of shared experiences.

Responsibilities include:

Build rapport with members by communicating personal experiences with a goal of increasing the likelihood of positive behavior changes. Coach members to create and implement strategies that minimize risks associated with the identified common health conditions and behaviors. Connect members to appropriate programs to address barriers to care and to enhance compliance. Link members to local, county and state services/resources. Follow up with members and serve as a member advocate, delivering their medications and other supplies as needed. Coordinate and/or accompany members to medical and social services appointments that fall outside of the street medicine unit. Introduce tools to promote self-management & self-efficacy. Complete all required organization and health plan specific documentation in a timely fashion. Some examples include and are not limited to the following: enter all patient touch points and encounter notes in HIA’s electronic health records system, member health risk, and update members’ Plan of Care after every street medicine encounter. Document all required information in the care management system during phone calls with members. Complete and submit a Monthly Audit Checklist assessment, individual care plans, and update member profiles in the Coordinated Entry System/HMIS. May occasionally drive the medically equipped van. Schedule encounters based on member’s acuity level using the Healthcare in Action electronic health record system. Work under the supervision of a Social Worker to ensure proper escalation of cases and coordination of care. Actively support the achievement of HIA’s Vision and Goals and particularly housing placement for unsheltered members. This position is a patient-facing role. Employees may be eligible for differential pay. Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and experience:

G.E.D./High School, required plus 3+ years of work experience as defined below. Bachelor’s degree preferred plus 1-2 years of work experience as defined below. Work Experience to include direct work experience, lived experience, training or volunteer work with patients experiencing homelessness, as well as those with active mental health and substance use conditions. Other demonstrated relevant experience in similar community settings, for example, working with other disadvantaged groups, and/or outreach will be considered. A comparable combination of education/experience and/or training will be considered equivalent to the education listed above. Ability to work in a dynamic, outdoors environment. Ability to work independently as well as part of a team. Ability to organize effectively. Ability to prioritize multiple and competing tasks. Ability to communicate effectively, including articulating one’s own relevant personal experiences. Excellent oral communication skills, as well as strong interpersonal skills. Maintenance of reliable transportation Proficiency in operating a computer, including logging into and maneuvering around multiple systems such as online timesheets (time and attendance) and call center software. HMIS/ Coordinated Entry System, preferred.Travel 50% or more- Must have a valid driver’s license, automobile insurance, reliable transportation, and clean driving record.

What's in it for you?

Base salary range: $21.78 to $34.86 per hourAn annual employee bonus programRobust Wellness ProgramGenerous paid-time-off (PTO)11 paid holidays per year, plus 1 additional floating holidayExcellent 401(k) Retirement Saving Plan with employer match.Robust employee recognition programTuition reimbursementAn opportunity to become part of a team that makes a difference to our members and our community every day!

title: Client Partner
description:
At Horizontal Digital, we hold ourselves to one key belief: You’re only as good as your worst customer experience. This mantra is what drives our digital consultancy to think beyond the easy answers and instead create websites, apps, portals and other experiences that solve customer needs for Fortune 500 companies in intuitive and empathetic ways. And we make this lofty standard a reality by fusing strategy, data, design and technology together to arrive at solutions that set the bar higher for everyone. 
We use these values to fuel superior results: 
Lock arms We forge relationships that make our impact 1,000x stronger. This means working across departments and engaging both our clients and our communities to deliver the greatest good. Show hustle We’re not ones to sit on our hands and wait. Instead, we anticipate opportunities, collectively roll up our sleeves and find ways to execute the exceptional. Embrace change From new technologies to workplace philosophies, we welcome the unexpected and constantly anticipate what’s next. Elevate empathy We listen before we take action. This means understanding a variety of perspectives and holding ourselves to a higher standard of accountability. Never settle We motivate each other to push past the easy answers and collectively arrive at bigger, more inspiring ideas.  But enough about us. Let’s talk about you. 
The Client Partner oversees and cultivates client relationships that in order to deliver measurable business impact to our clients. The Client Partner is responsible for overseeing the growth, management, retention, and satisfaction of his or her portfolio of clients.The ideal candidate has a fervent passion for transforming customer experiences through experience strategy and technical implementations. They have proven track record of managing, retaining and persistently expanding within their client portfolio – proactively guiding clients through meaningful changes, and directly impacting profitable y-o-y growth for their consultancy. The Client Partner deeply understands their client’s business strategy and goals, within broader industry context, and can effectively aligning client needs with Horizontal’s service offerings to positively impacting our client’s business and their customer experiences. The Client Partner has insatiable curiosity for navigating complex business and digital strategies, motivating and advising clients through significant transformation, while also contributing to a vibrant culture within Horizontal. 
What you’ll do: Directly lead and manage a portfolio of multiple accounts, typically $8-12M Build advisory relationships that result in business impact and revenue growth: Ability to network within a client organization; create, own and expand the senior and executive relationships within a clients’ organizationAble to navigate the complexities of a large organizationAbility to conduct and create opportunities for advisory conversations through the power of executive presence, persuasive content and compelling business insightsOwn the 360-degree view of our clients (their organization, remit, reporting structure, goals, and financing) Lead client mapping activities — ensuring client relationships are nurtured with the ideal personnel from HorizontalFoster internal obsession with our clients’ business, experience, technology and brand goals amongst the Horizontal teamLead the successful onboarding of Horizontal to client and client to Horizontal, including project kickoff and a seamless transition to delivery leadershipLeverage your industry expertise to guide clients through the myriad of solutions and opportunities to ensure clients have the opportunity to make confident, informed decisionsDrive organic growth and ensure account-level profitability: Ability to author and execute a 12–18-month strategic plan for each of your accounts, articulating, pursuing and landing opportunities to expand Horizontal’s footprint within the client organizationAbility to build stewardship with clients, acting as their strategic consultant, solidifying relationships and ensuring profitable YoY growthManage quarterly revenue closely, ensure all opportunities are accurately reflected and forecasted, and uphold annual commitmentsLead scope definition across multiple complex client accounts – including shaping ambiguous asks into proposals and contracts, including defendable statements of work, but with a focus on achieving mutually beneficial outcomes for client and consultancyMaintain a thorough understanding of the Horizontal service offerings and cross functional areas to enable cross selling across capabilities — creating more sustainable and diverse portfoliosEstablish relationships with platform reps (e.g., Sitecore, Salesforce, etc.) Form strong partnerships with internal Horizontal capability teams:Inspire and support delivery excellence while representing the client voice to ensure we are meeting client expectations and driving outcomesPartner on new business efforts in order to bring your industry expertise to set up new engagements for successPartner with delivery and operations to ensure forecasts are clean and accurate
Who you are: You are a customer experience enthusiast who can understand and support a program with complex business, user experience and technical challenges, and have a proven track record supporting client and internal teams in achieving digital solutionsYou have a thirst for knowledge – especially business acumen – and thrive in creating commercially viable opportunities for the firm that drive growth for clientsYou exude confidence, persistence, and the ability to stay optimistic despite multiple projects and goals, and thrive amidst an environment with multiple demands and rapid change. You see ambiguity through the lens of opportunity, rather than of concernYou are recognized as trusted, empathetic, and accountable in relationships with clients, colleagues, partners, and other industry professionals
How you will be measured:Ability to identify and roadmap account strategies and OKRs ensuring a measurable approach to the impact Horizontal has on our clients’ businessesAbility to expand Horizontal Digital’s service offering in support of achieving client’s business goalsRevenue and sales margin targetsClient satisfaction measured by NPS measurementThought leadershipPartner certifications where applicable
What you bring:  Exemplary stakeholder management and communication skills Proven experience in growing key and growth clients, of $10M+Ability to define and drive strategic vision and orchestrate and create consensus around ideas, concepts to then drive outcomes Strong leadership and communication skills: ability to lead meetings and presentations with senior clients, as well as inspire, organize and create consensus around ideas, concepts and approaches internallyIndustry expertise and experience for your relevant industry focus areaExperience with Salesforce (Marketing Cloud, Einstein Analytics, Experience Cloud, Core) and Sitecore and/or other composable DXP preferredStrong financial acumen: skilled in forecasting and revenue management Bachelor's degree and minimum of 7 years of experience in a digital agency, consultancy or digital product development environment Job Keywords: Digital Transformation, Marketing Transformation, MarTech, Client Partner, Executive Client Partner, consulting, Experience Transformation, Experience Strategy, Business Strategy, Strategic Account Management, consultancy, Client Success, Partner, Account Executive, Senior Client Partner 
The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Digital Marketing Analyst
About Evans Distribution SystemsEvans Distribution Systems is a privately-owned third-party logistics company based out of Melvindale, Mich. Our company is run by a fourth-generation leadership and has operated 3 million square feet of warehousing space in Southeast Michigan for more than 90 years. Evans provides warehousing, fulfillment, value-added, transportation, and staffing services for a variety of customers in automotive, food/beverage, consumer goods, hazmat, paper/raw materials, and government service sectors. 
Why We’re UniqueAt Evans we care about our employees. We have a robust quality program that focuses on continuous improvement, lean operations, and ISO:9001 2015 certification. We believe in a workplace that celebrates integrity, innovation and technology across all divisions. We embrace a diverse workforce with associates from many backgrounds, education, and professional disciplines. Discover for yourself why the Evans family continues to grow and how our customers have come to know, it’s easier with Evans.  Reports to: Director of Marketing 
Overview: Primarily accountable for support of key digital marketing initiatives and data. This role is responsible for producing and managing content calendar, managing social networks, tracking marketing KPIs, reporting on customer survey data, distributing the e-newsletter, and creating automated email campaigns. Other responsibilities include monitoring and reporting on digital ad campaigns and SEO maintenance. Other graphical projects will be assigned on an as needed basis. 
Responsibilities:Email Marketing: Executes email communications including monthly newsletter, targeted campaigns, and automated campaign set-up. Maintains lists and generates reports from sales database. Manages contacts from web leads and unsubscribes. 
Content Marketing: Contributes at least (3) pieces of content per month. Assists in topic generation and social media calendar. Tracks and reports on content performance and ROI from email marketing software and social media. Identifies areas for improvement.
Sales & Marketing KPIs/Reporting: Tracks and reports on key performance indicators in sales and marketing from social media, GA4, sales database, SEO tools, etc. Provides annual report that compares analytics year-over-year. Manages the dashboard and presents key data points during internal/external sales meetings. Creates quarterly presentations of customer survey data. Creates monthly new business reports. Pulls freight activity reports. Draws big picture conclusions and trends from data; advises on new courses of action. 
Social Media Management: Manages social media accounts and posting calendar. Responds to inquiries through social media accounts. Identifies avenues to grow audience and engagement performance. 
Graphics & Brand Management: Utilizes graphic design software to create and update our branded marketing materials. Promotes brand consistency in content. Contributes to creative brainstorming. 
Website Maintenance: Assists in website maintenance to ensure functionality. Contributes to overall design changes and enhancements. Troubleshoots website issues. Enhances website to improve SEO performance. Assists in lead/data management through web forms. 
Google Advertising: Creates and strategizes digital advertising campaigns with an emphasis on Google Ads. Also, responsible for monitoring and reporting on the performance results of the ads.
SEO: Implements SEO strategies and improvements to increase KPIs. This includes monthly site crawls within SEO tools to optimize website performance. Contributes to keyword and content strategy to increase search rankings. 
 Marketing Materials: Assists in creating and managing marketing materials with the expressed goal of providing more information for customers, driving sales, or assisting sales team during the sales process. Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s Degree. Experience: 3-5 years marketing experienceKnowledge/Skills: Requires a thorough understanding of the Microsoft 365 office products and marketing campaign measurement tools. Requires excellent writing and communication skills. B2B marketing experience, social media expertise, web management, email campaign development and branding experience preferred. Preferred knowledge of Google Suite and knowledge of SEO monitoring tools. Training: Annual conference and/or seminar in logistics, sales, or marketing.Travel: No travel is required for this position.Other Skills and Abilities:· Organizational skills required.· Excellent oral and written communication skills required.· Computer skills with the ability to learn and apply a variety of different software programs.· Training and experience with word processing, presentation graphics, and database software.· Typing, grammar, and letter writing skills required.· Analytical skills required.
Details & Location· Position located at the headquarters office at 18765 Seaway Drive, Melvindale, MI 48122. · This is not a remote job. 
How to ApplyPlease submit your resume through our website at www.EVANSDIST.com/careers.aspx. Call our Human Resources Department if you have questions (313) 827-9182.
